Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: 3D cubic rigid structure with microporous triangular windows (5–7 Å free diameter)

Other Information.Test Conditions: 100 °C for 1 min, then ramp at 10 °C/min to 160 °C
Other Information.Additional Info: Linear hexane is less retained than branched isomers.

Other Information.Additional Info: Branched isomer; more strongly retained than linear hexane.

140 °C for 1 min, then ramp at 10 °C/min to 180 °C
140 °C for 1 min, then ramp at 10 °C/min to 180 °C
Other Information.Additional Info: o-xylene exhibits the strongest retention due to higher polarity and Van der Waals interactions.

Sieving Mechanism: Combination of reverse shape selectivity and molecular sieving effect.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Excellent selectivity and precision; theoretical plate numbers reported for various analytes.

Other Information.Additional Info: The material demonstrates preferential retention of branched alkane isomers over linear ones, showcasing reverse shape selectivity. Bulkier molecules like 1,3,5-trimethylbenzene are excluded from micropores, illustrating molecular sieving effects.
